alert.note: Alert for Clay; East Polk; Mahnomen; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; West Becker; West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 3:39AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTERY MIX OF PRECIPITATION RETURNS... A fast moving system will approach southeastern North Dakota late this afternoon and continue into portions of Minnesota this evening. With the return of warmer temperatures, there is the potential for a mix of snow, sleet, and even freezing rain, with a 10 to 20 percent chance for a light glaze of ice. While probabilities are not high and any amounts will be very light, even small amounts of freezing rain can cause travel impacts. The precipitation is expected to change over to snow as it moves into northwestern and north central Minnesota after midnight. Roadways and sidewalks could become slick this evening. Those traveling tonight into Monday morning should slow down, use extra caution, and check the latest road conditions from the North Dakota and Minnesota Departments of Transportation.

area.areaDesc: Clay; East Polk; Mahnomen; Norman; Pennington; Red Lake; West Becker; West Polk
